title: Theory-Based Instructional Design Strategies for Higher Education Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Language Proficiency and Fundamental Learning Theory Concepts
context.additional_context: Learners include university students and job seekers from diverse academic backgrounds, operating in a self-directed learning environment using personal mobile devices (tablets/smartphones).

learning_goals: Learners can apply major learning theories (constructivism, cognitivism, etc.) to language learning design.
Learners can develop online language lesson materials by utilizing instructional design models such as ADDIE/ARCS.
Learners can design theory-based assessment tools in an LMS environment to measure the effectiveness of language proficiency improvement.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
